poem:
"Breath of the Modern Dragon"

The dragon sleeps, beneath steel and flares,
In crisp suits and boardroom chairs.
Its breath veiled in emerald's glare,
Masked by techno-rapt enthral, no emission bears. 
From US to UK, to Germany's lairs,
Like ink hiding in an octopus's snare,
the world gasps, drowned in silent airs,
its plea unheard, lost in corporate affairs.
